org.openstreetmap.travelingsalesman
Interface INavigatableComponent

public interface INavigatableComponent

An component that can be navigated by a mapmover. Used as map view and for the zoomer in the download dialog. Taken from he JOSM-Codebase.

Author:
imi

Method Detail

getDataSet

IDataSet getDataSet()
Returns:
the map we render.

getPoint

java.awt.Point getPoint(EastNorth aPoint)
Return the point on the screen where this Coordinate would be.

Parameters:
aPoint - The point, where this geopoint would be drawn.
Returns:
The point on screen where "point" would be drawn, relative to the own top/left.

getLatLon

LatLon getLatLon(int x,
                 int y)
Parameters:
x - X-Pixelposition to get coordinate from
y - Y-Pixelposition to get coordinate from
Returns:
Geographic unprojected coordinates from a specific pixel coordination on the screen.

getScale

double getScale()
Return the current scale value. The scale factor in x or y-units per pixel. This means, if scale = 10, every physical pixel on screen are 10 x or 10 y units in the northing/easting space of the projection.

Returns:
The scale value currently used in display

getCenter

EastNorth getCenter()
Returns:
Returns the center point. A copy is returned, so users cannot change the center by accessing the return value. Use zoomTo instead.

getLeftUpper

LatLon getLeftUpper()
Returns:
Returns the left upper point. A copy is returned, so users cannot change the center by accessing the return value. Use zoomTo instead.

getHeight

int getHeight()
Get the height of the map-area in pixels.

Returns:
the height

getWidth

int getWidth()
Get the width of the map-area in pixels.

Returns:
width

addPropertyChangeListener

void addPropertyChangeListener(java.lang.String aProperty,
                               java.beans.PropertyChangeListener aListener)
Add a new listener for property-changes. Valid properties are at least "center" and "scale".

Parameters:
aProperty - the property to register for
aListener - the listener

getZoom

int getZoom()
Returns:
the OSM-conforming zoom factor (0 for whole world, 1 for half, 2 for quarter...).

getProjection

Projection getProjection()
Get the projection-method to use.

Returns:
the projection

zoomTo

void zoomTo(EastNorth aCenter,
            double aZoomLevel)
Zoom to the given location at the given zoom-level.

Parameters:
aCenter - the new center-point to display
aZoomLevel - The scale factor in x or y-units per pixel. This means, if scale = 10, every physical pixel on screen are 10 x or 10 y units in the northing/easting space of the projection.

                       int y)
Parameters:
x - X-pixel-position to get coordinate from
y - Y-pixel-position to get coordinate from
Returns:
Geographic coordinates from a specific pixel coordination on the screen.
